summary: PFAS—known as “forever chemicals”—can remain in the environment for a long time and cause health problems. For decades, Department of Energy sites across the U.S. have used PFAS for firefighting and other purposes, potentially leading to releases into the environment. DOE is early in the process of investigating PFAS contamination. DOE has directed all its sites to review their PFAS use, but didn’t set a...
title: Persistent Chemicals: DOE Should Complete Efforts to Review PFAS Use
